Business Information: EyeCare Associates is proud to be a medically based optometric group serving Alabama.  Our team of highly trained optometrists, opticians, and technicians focus on maintaining the health and development of your eyes by providing the most comprehensive eye exam on the market.

Dr. David O'Leary is the local eye doctor to see for all of your eye care needs in Birmingham, AL. As your local Birmingham optometrist, Dr. David O'Leary can help diagnose, treat, and detect subtle changes in your eyes year over year. Come visit our offices at 5066 Pinnacle Square Birmingham, AL 35235 and let us help you see and look your best. Our doctors are here to provide the professional eye care near you, to guarantee you have the clearest vision. Call today to schedule an appointment for your annual eye exam.

Alabama Eye & Cataract Center provides Cataract Surgery and Intraocular Lens Implants (IOL), Corneal Transplants, Corneal Surgery and Eye Exams with Cataract Surgeon and Corneal Specialist Marc Michelson, M.D. in Birmingham, Alabama AL. Alabama Eye & Cataract Center has been serving the Cornea and Cataract Surgery needs of greater Birmingham and Alabama patients for over 20 years. Visit www.michelsonlaser.com  for patient eye care information or follow facebook.com/michelsonlaservision to stay connected with news, updates and special offers. Patients can schedule appointments by calling 205-930-0930.

Tracey L. Mercer has been a leading provider of optometry services and vision care products in Shelby County for the last 15 years. In January 2015, she opened a new practice in the Hoover community to help you achieve and maintain clear vision for years to come. Our experienced eye doctor offers comprehensive vision exams at our Hoover optometry office and specializes in the diagnosis and treatment of a wide array of eye diseases, conditions, and problems. We use advanced diagnostic technology and vision correction products and are committed to improving the quality of life of persons in Shelby County through enhanced vision. Give yourself the gift of clear vision– schedule an appointment with Tracey L. Mercer, OD today.

Stop by for high-quality prescription glasses starting $95, plus sunglasses, progressives, and a variety of contact lenses (including our own brand, Scout)—and we offer eye exams. Also find friendly advisors and top-notch optometrists who can help you find the perfect pair.

Dr. VicinanzoÃƒÂ¢Ã¢"šÂ¬Ã¢"žÂ¢s practice encompasses reconstructive and cosmetic surgery of the orbits, eyelids, brows, and lacrimal system due to trauma, cancer, congenital defects, systemic diseases, and aging. He received his undergraduate degree with honors from Harvard University and his medical degree with honors from the Syracuse College of Medicine at the State University of New York. His specialty training in ophthalmology was done at Vanderbilt University, followed by a 2 year ASOPRS fellowship in oculoplastic, orbital, and reconstructive surgery at UAB Medical Center and The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital. Dr. Vicinanzo serves as an Assistant Clinical Professor for the Department of Ophthalmology at UAB, where he actively teaches oculoplastic surgery to the resident doctors at The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital, the Birmingham VA Hospital, and UAB Medial Center. He is a member and he serves as an associate preceptor for The American Society of Oculoplastics and Reconstructive Surgery (ASOPRS) in the training of certified fellows. Dr. Vicinanzo is certified by the American Board of Ophthalmology and is a diplomat of the American Academy of Ophthalmology. He is currently involved in multiple eye and oculplastic research studies. Dr. Vicinanzo was elected to Best Doctors in America in 2009. For patientsÃƒÂ¢Ã¢"šÂ¬Ã¢"žÂ¢ convenience, Dr. Vicinanzo is now seeing patients at our satellite offices in Huntsville and Montgomery. All appointments for these offices can be made through our main office in Birmingham.

Alabama Vision Center has established a long and true tradition of professional excellence, defined by training, experience, state-of-the-art technology and world-class care. Our goal is to enhance the quality of our patients’ lives by helping them achieve the best vision possible.

Dr. Price Kloess, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and corneal transplantation surgery. Dr. Kloess is a clinical assistant for the Eye Hospital in Birmingham. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and served as President of the Alabama Academy of Ophthalmology.

Holly Young, OD, received her undergraduate Bachelor of Arts degree in Biology from the University of Mississippi and her Doctorate of Optometry from the University of Alabama School of Optometry in Birmingham, Alabama. She is a member of the Beta Sigma Kappa Honor Society and the American Optometric Association. After an externship with our practice, she joined Alabama Vision Center in June 2010. Dr. Young specializes in comprehensive adult and pediatric eye examinations for the detection of medical eye diseases such as cataracts, glaucoma, macular degeneration and diabetes. She fits all types of eyeglasses and contact lens and provides preoperative and postoperative care for cataract surgery and LASIK.

Dr. Andrew Velazquez, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and advanced corneal transplantation surgery. He completed his residency at the University of Florida and a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Duke University. Dr. Velazquez has served as Assistant Professor of Ophthalmology, Director of Cornea and External Disease, and Director of Refractive Surgery at The Callahan Eye Hospital in Birmingham, Alabama. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and Clinical Assistant at the Eye Hospital.

Andrew Bartlett, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK vision correction, "no stitch" cataract surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, and corneal transplantation surgery. Born and raised in Birmingham, Dr. Bartlett attended the University of Alabama at Birmingham School of Medicine before completing his residency at Texas Tech University in Lubbock, Texas. He then continued his training with a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Eye Consultants of Atlanta.

Dr. Kelsey McCluskey, OD, graduated from Troy University with a Bachelor's of Science degree in Biomedical Science with a minor in Mathematics. She then graduated with a Doctorate of Optometry from the Kentucky College of Optometry. She is an active member of the American Optometric Association and the Alabama Optometric Association. Dr. McCluskey's clinical services include: comprehensive routine eye care, treatment and management of ocular diseases such asdiabetic retinopathy, macular degeneration, dry eyes, glaucoma, and binocular vision disorders. Dr. McCluskey also fits specialty contact lenses including scleral lenses and orthokeratology lenses for myopia control.

Dr. Jessica Duddleston, MD, is a comprehensive ophthalmologist specializing in cataract surgery, laser eye procedures, medical and surgical glaucoma, diabetic eye exams, and macular degeneration, among other things. Dr. Duddleston completed her ophthalmology residency at the distinguished University of North Carolina where she was elected chief resident during her senior year and received Resident Teacher of the year award. Her work is published in Ophthalmology Retina journal and has presented her work at Ophthalmology conferences including Women in Ophthalmology and American Academy of Ophthalmology.
MyEyeDr. is your trusted community doctor providing the best in vision health care and the best selection of eyewear. We welcome all insurances.

InSight Eye Group is a premier eye care facility located in Homewood, AL. Our office and eye doctors are dedicated to providing excellence in patient care, clinical education, and optical services. Our doctors are leaders in clinical eye care involving eye and vision disorders. We provide the highest quality lenses, frames and contact lenses to solve the vision needs of our patients.

Schaeffer Eye Center is one of the leading optometrists in Alabama. Located in Irondale, Ala., the center provides medically oriented eye examination with state-of-the-art diagnostic equipment which test for diabetes, glaucoma and other eye diseases. It houses a contact lens center which carries disposable, extended wear, astigmatism and bifocal lens. The center also offers designer frames and sunglasses from Cartier, Betsey Johnson and LA Eyeworks. Schaeffer Eye Center operates more than 15 locations across Birmingham, Huntsville, Tuscaloosa and Montgomery.

Stanton Optical is among the nation’s fastest growing, full-service optical retail centers with a mission of making eye care easy and accessible when you need it most. Stanton Optical’s onsite labs offer same day service and buy online pick up in-store. Eye exams are always available via same-day appointments and walk-ins, or go online for a quick vision test to update your prescription. With friendly and knowledgeable customer service and over 2,000 frames to choose from, Stanton Optical is the one-stop shop for all your eye care needs. To schedule an appointment, visit our website or call 800-STANTON today!

We work hard to ensure that you know exactly where your vision health stands, update you on the latest in eye care trends, and then give you next steps to ensure you have healthy vision for years and years to come.

Dr Goldschmidt graduated from the University of Alabama School of Optometry in 1992. She has been caring for patients in the Gardendale area for 17 years. She is a member of the Alabama Optometric Association, American Optometric Society, American Optometric Society Sports Vision and NATA National Association of Athletic Trainers She was raised in Pelham Alabama and earned a Bachelors of Science degree at Auburn University. She and her husband, Lloyd, have 2 wonderful kids: Casey and Jenny. She entered the field of Sports Vision Training by seeking out the most knowledgeable and experienced professional in this new and growing field. She chose to train with an established professional who has been working in this field for 30 years and has a track record of effectively training professional athletes and members of Police Tactical Teams and Military Special Forces. Her personal and professional goal is to help athletes and individuals perform at their peak by offering the most effective services and technology to achieve this. Her personal interests include reading anything and everything, spending time outdoors as much as possible, all kinds of arts and crafts and doing whatever is possible to help the young people in our community become educated responsible individuals. Her mission and vision for Southern Focus is to provide a professional and caring environment for our community to receive the very best in eyecare.

Dr. Price Kloess, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and corneal transplantation surgery. Dr. Kloess is a clinical assistant for the Eye Hospital in Birmingham. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and served as President of the Alabama Academy of Ophthalmology.

Holly Young, OD, received her undergraduate Bachelor of Arts degree in Biology from the University of Mississippi and her Doctorate of Optometry from the University of Alabama School of Optometry in Birmingham, Alabama. She is a member of the Beta Sigma Kappa Honor Society and the American Optometric Association. After an externship with our practice, she joined Alabama Vision Center in June 2010. Dr. Young specializes in comprehensive adult and pediatric eye examinations for the detection of medical eye diseases such as cataracts, glaucoma, macular degeneration and diabetes. She fits all types of eyeglasses and contact lens and provides preoperative and postoperative care for cataract surgery and LASIK.

Dr. Andrew Velazquez, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and advanced corneal transplantation surgery. He completed his residency at the University of Florida and a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Duke University. Dr. Velazquez has served as Assistant Professor of Ophthalmology, Director of Cornea and External Disease, and Director of Refractive Surgery at The Callahan Eye Hospital in Birmingham, Alabama. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and Clinical Assistant at the Eye Hospital.

Andrew Bartlett, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK vision correction, "no stitch" cataract surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, and corneal transplantation surgery. Born and raised in Birmingham, Dr. Bartlett attended the University of Alabama at Birmingham School of Medicine before completing his residency at Texas Tech University in Lubbock, Texas. He then continued his training with a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Eye Consultants of Atlanta.

Dr. Kelsey McCluskey, OD, graduated from Troy University with a Bachelor's of Science degree in Biomedical Science with a minor in Mathematics. She then graduated with a Doctorate of Optometry from the Kentucky College of Optometry. She is an active member of the American Optometric Association and the Alabama Optometric Association. Dr. McCluskey's clinical services include: comprehensive routine eye care, treatment and management of ocular diseases such asdiabetic retinopathy, macular degeneration, dry eyes, glaucoma, and binocular vision disorders. Dr. McCluskey also fits specialty contact lenses including scleral lenses and orthokeratology lenses for myopia control.

Dr. Jessica Duddleston, MD, is a comprehensive ophthalmologist specializing in cataract surgery, laser eye procedures, medical and surgical glaucoma, diabetic eye exams, and macular degeneration, among other things. Dr. Duddleston completed her ophthalmology residency at the distinguished University of North Carolina where she was elected chief resident during her senior year and received Resident Teacher of the year award. Her work is published in Ophthalmology Retina journal and has presented her work at Ophthalmology conferences including Women in Ophthalmology and American Academy of Ophthalmology.

Dr. VicinanzoÃƒÂ¢Ã¢"šÂ¬Ã¢"žÂ¢s practice encompasses reconstructive and cosmetic surgery of the orbits, eyelids, brows, and lacrimal system due to trauma, cancer, congenital defects, systemic diseases, and aging. He received his undergraduate degree with honors from Harvard University and his medical degree with honors from the Syracuse College of Medicine at the State University of New York. His specialty training in ophthalmology was done at Vanderbilt University, followed by a 2 year ASOPRS fellowship in oculoplastic, orbital, and reconstructive surgery at UAB Medical Center and The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital. Dr. Vicinanzo serves as an Assistant Clinical Professor for the Department of Ophthalmology at UAB, where he actively teaches oculoplastic surgery to the resident doctors at The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital, the Birmingham VA Hospital, and UAB Medial Center. He is a member and he serves as an associate preceptor for The American Society of Oculoplastics and Reconstructive Surgery (ASOPRS) in the training of certified fellows. Dr. Vicinanzo is certified by the American Board of Ophthalmology and is a diplomat of the American Academy of Ophthalmology. He is currently involved in multiple eye and oculplastic research studies. Dr. Vicinanzo was elected to Best Doctors in America in 2009. Dr. Price Kloess, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and corneal transplantation surgery. Dr. Kloess is a clinical assistant for the Eye Hospital in Birmingham. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and served as President of the Alabama Academy of Ophthalmology.

Holly Young, OD, received her undergraduate Bachelor of Arts degree in Biology from the University of Mississippi and her Doctorate of Optometry from the University of Alabama School of Optometry in Birmingham, Alabama. She is a member of the Beta Sigma Kappa Honor Society and the American Optometric Association. After an externship with our practice, she joined Alabama Vision Center in June 2010. Dr. Young specializes in comprehensive adult and pediatric eye examinations for the detection of medical eye diseases such as cataracts, glaucoma, macular degeneration and diabetes. She fits all types of eyeglasses and contact lens and provides preoperative and postoperative care for cataract surgery and LASIK.

Dr. Andrew Velazquez, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and advanced corneal transplantation surgery. He completed his residency at the University of Florida and a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Duke University. Dr. Velazquez has served as Assistant Professor of Ophthalmology, Director of Cornea and External Disease, and Director of Refractive Surgery at The Callahan Eye Hospital in Birmingham, Alabama. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and Clinical Assistant at the Eye Hospital.

Andrew Bartlett, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK vision correction, "no stitch" cataract surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, and corneal transplantation surgery. Born and raised in Birmingham, Dr. Bartlett attended the University of Alabama at Birmingham School of Medicine before completing his residency at Texas Tech University in Lubbock, Texas. He then continued his training with a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Eye Consultants of Atlanta.

Dr. Kelsey McCluskey, OD, graduated from Troy University with a Bachelor's of Science degree in Biomedical Science with a minor in Mathematics. She then graduated with a Doctorate of Optometry from the Kentucky College of Optometry. She is an active member of the American Optometric Association and the Alabama Optometric Association. Dr. McCluskey's clinical services include: comprehensive routine eye care, treatment and management of ocular diseases such asdiabetic retinopathy, macular degeneration, dry eyes, glaucoma, and binocular vision disorders. Dr. McCluskey also fits specialty contact lenses including scleral lenses and orthokeratology lenses for myopia control.

Dr. Jessica Duddleston, MD, is a comprehensive ophthalmologist specializing in cataract surgery, laser eye procedures, medical and surgical glaucoma, diabetic eye exams, and macular degeneration, among other things. Dr. Duddleston completed her ophthalmology residency at the distinguished University of North Carolina where she was elected chief resident during her senior year and received Resident Teacher of the year award. Her work is published in Ophthalmology Retina journal and has presented her work at Ophthalmology conferences including Women in Ophthalmology and American Academy of Ophthalmology.

Dr Goldschmidt graduated from the University of Alabama School of Optometry in 1992. She has been caring for patients in the Gardendale area for 17 years. She entered the field of Sports Vision Training by seeking out the most knowledgeable and experienced professional in this new and growing field. She chose to train with an established professional who has been working in this field for 30 years and has a track record of effectively training professional athletes and members of Police Tactical Teams and Military Special Forces. Her personal and professional goal is to help athletes and individuals perform at their peak by offering the most effective services and technology to achieve this. Her personal interests include reading anything and everything, spending time outdoors as much as possible, all kinds of arts and crafts and doing whatever is possible to help the young people in our community become educated responsible individuals. Her mission and vision for Southern Focus is to provide a professional and caring environment for our community to receive the very best in eyecare.

Holly Young, OD, received her undergraduate Bachelor of Arts degree in Biology from the University of Mississippi and her Doctorate of Optometry from the University of Alabama School of Optometry in Birmingham, Alabama. She is a member of the Beta Sigma Kappa Honor Society and the American Optometric Association. After an externship with our practice, she joined Alabama Vision Center in June 2010. Dr. Young specializes in comprehensive adult and pediatric eye examinations for the detection of medical eye diseases such as cataracts, glaucoma, macular degeneration and diabetes. She fits all types of eyeglasses and contact lens and provides preoperative and postoperative care for cataract surgery and LASIK.

Dr. Andrew Velazquez, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and advanced corneal transplantation surgery. He completed his residency at the University of Florida and a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Duke University. Dr. Velazquez has served as Assistant Professor of Ophthalmology, Director of Cornea and External Disease, and Director of Refractive Surgery at The Callahan Eye Hospital in Birmingham, Alabama. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and Clinical Assistant at the Eye Hospital.

Andrew Bartlett, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK vision correction, "no stitch" cataract surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, and corneal transplantation surgery. Born and raised in Birmingham, Dr. Bartlett attended the University of Alabama at Birmingham School of Medicine before completing his residency at Texas Tech University in Lubbock, Texas. He then continued his training with a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Eye Consultants of Atlanta.

Dr. Kelsey McCluskey, OD, graduated from Troy University with a Bachelor's of Science degree in Biomedical Science with a minor in Mathematics. She then graduated with a Doctorate of Optometry from the Kentucky College of Optometry. She is an active member of the American Optometric Association and the Alabama Optometric Association. Dr. McCluskey's clinical services include: comprehensive routine eye care, treatment and management of ocular diseases such asdiabetic retinopathy, macular degeneration, dry eyes, glaucoma, and binocular vision disorders. Dr. McCluskey also fits specialty contact lenses including scleral lenses and orthokeratology lenses for myopia control.

Dr. Jessica Duddleston, MD, is a comprehensive ophthalmologist specializing in cataract surgery, laser eye procedures, medical and surgical glaucoma, diabetic eye exams, and macular degeneration, among other things. Dr. Duddleston completed her ophthalmology residency at the distinguished University of North Carolina where she was elected chief resident during her senior year and received Resident Teacher of the year award. Her work is published in Ophthalmology Retina journal and has presented her work at Ophthalmology conferences including Women in Ophthalmology and American Academy of Ophthalmology.

Dr Goldschmidt graduated from the University of Alabama School of Optometry in 1992. She has been caring for patients in the Gardendale area for 17 years. She is a member of the Alabama Optometric Association, American Optometric Society, American Optometric Society Sports Vision and NATA National Association of Athletic Trainers She was raised in Pelham Alabama and earned a Bachelors of Science degree at Auburn University. She and her husband, Lloyd, have 2 wonderful kids: Casey and Jenny. She entered the field of Sports Vision Training by seeking out the most knowledgeable and experienced professional in this new and growing field. She chose to train with an established professional who has been working in this field for 30 years and has a track record of effectively training professional athletes and members of Police Tactical Teams and Military Special Forces. Her personal and professional goal is to help athletes and individuals perform at their peak by offering the most effective services and technology to achieve this. Her personal interests include reading anything and everything, spending time outdoors as much as possible, all kinds of arts and crafts and doing whatever is possible to help the young people in our community become educated responsible individuals. Her mission and vision for Southern Focus is to provide a professional and caring environment for our community to receive the very best in eyecare.

Dr. VicinanzoÃƒÂ¢Ã¢"šÂ¬Ã¢"žÂ¢s practice encompasses reconstructive and cosmetic surgery of the orbits, eyelids, brows, and lacrimal system due to trauma, cancer, congenital defects, systemic diseases, and aging. He received his undergraduate degree with honors from Harvard University and his medical degree with honors from the Syracuse College of Medicine at the State University of New York. His specialty training in ophthalmology was done at Vanderbilt University, followed by a 2 year ASOPRS fellowship in oculoplastic, orbital, and reconstructive surgery at UAB Medical Center and The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital. Dr. Vicinanzo serves as an Assistant Clinical Professor for the Department of Ophthalmology at UAB, where he actively teaches oculoplastic surgery to the resident doctors at The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital, the Birmingham VA Hospital, and UAB Medial Center. He is a member and he serves as an associate preceptor for The American Society of Oculoplastics and Reconstructive Surgery (ASOPRS) in the training of certified fellows. Dr. Vicinanzo is certified by the American Board of Ophthalmology and is a diplomat of the American Academy of Ophthalmology. He is currently involved in multiple eye and oculplastic research studies. Dr. Vicinanzo was elected to Best Doctors in America in 2009. Alabama Vision Center has established a long and true tradition of professional excellence, defined by training, experience, state-of-the-art technology and world-class care. Our goal is to enhance the quality of our patients’ lives by helping them achieve the best vision possible.

Dr. Price Kloess, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and corneal transplantation surgery. Dr. Kloess is a clinical assistant for the Eye Hospital in Birmingham. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and served as President of the Alabama Academy of Ophthalmology.

Holly Young, OD, received her undergraduate Bachelor of Arts degree in Biology from the University of Mississippi and her Doctorate of Optometry from the University of Alabama School of Optometry in Birmingham, Alabama. She is a member of the Beta Sigma Kappa Honor Society and the American Optometric Association. After an externship with our practice, she joined Alabama Vision Center in June 2010. Dr. Young specializes in comprehensive adult and pediatric eye examinations for the detection of medical eye diseases such as cataracts, glaucoma, macular degeneration and diabetes. She fits all types of eyeglasses and contact lens and provides preoperative and postoperative care for cataract surgery and LASIK.

Dr. Andrew Velazquez, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and advanced corneal transplantation surgery. He completed his residency at the University of Florida and a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Duke University. Dr. Velazquez has served as Assistant Professor of Ophthalmology, Director of Cornea and External Disease, and Director of Refractive Surgery at The Callahan Eye Hospital in Birmingham, Alabama. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and Clinical Assistant at the Eye Hospital.

Andrew Bartlett, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK vision correction, "no stitch" cataract surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, and corneal transplantation surgery. Born and raised in Birmingham, Dr. Bartlett attended the University of Alabama at Birmingham School of Medicine before completing his residency at Texas Tech University in Lubbock, Texas. He then continued his training with a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Eye Consultants of Atlanta.

Dr. Kelsey McCluskey, OD, graduated from Troy University with a Bachelor's of Science degree in Biomedical Science with a minor in Mathematics. She then graduated with a Doctorate of Optometry from the Kentucky College of Optometry. She is an active member of the American Optometric Association and the Alabama Optometric Association. Dr. McCluskey's clinical services include: comprehensive routine eye care, treatment and management of ocular diseases such asdiabetic retinopathy, macular degeneration, dry eyes, glaucoma, and binocular vision disorders. Dr. McCluskey also fits specialty contact lenses including scleral lenses and orthokeratology lenses for myopia control.

Dr. Jessica Duddleston, MD, is a comprehensive ophthalmologist specializing in cataract surgery, laser eye procedures, medical and surgical glaucoma, diabetic eye exams, and macular degeneration, among other things. Dr. Duddleston completed her ophthalmology residency at the distinguished University of North Carolina where she was elected chief resident during her senior year and received Resident Teacher of the year award. Her work is published in Ophthalmology Retina journal and has presented her work at Ophthalmology conferences including Women in Ophthalmology and American Academy of Ophthalmology.

Dr Goldschmidt graduated from the University of Alabama School of Optometry in 1992. She has been caring for patients in the Gardendale area for 17 years. She is a member of the Alabama Optometric Association, American Optometric Society, American Optometric Society Sports Vision and NATA National Association of Athletic Trainers She was raised in Pelham Alabama and earned a Bachelors of Science degree at Auburn University. She and her husband, Lloyd, have 2 wonderful kids: Casey and Jenny. She entered the field of Sports Vision Training by seeking out the most knowledgeable and experienced professional in this new and growing field. She chose to train with an established professional who has been working in this field for 30 years and has a track record of effectively training professional athletes and members of Police Tactical Teams and Military Special Forces. Her personal and professional goal is to help athletes and individuals perform at their peak by offering the most effective services and technology to achieve this. Her personal interests include reading anything and everything, spending time outdoors as much as possible, all kinds of arts and crafts and doing whatever is possible to help the young people in our community become educated responsible individuals. Her mission and vision for Southern Focus is to provide a professional and caring environment for our community to receive the very best in eyecare.

Alabama Vision Center has established a long and true tradition of professional excellence, defined by training, experience, state-of-the-art technology and world-class care. Our goal is to enhance the quality of our patients’ lives by helping them achieve the best vision possible.

Dr. Price Kloess, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and corneal transplantation surgery. Dr. Kloess is a clinical assistant for the Eye Hospital in Birmingham. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and served as President of the Alabama Academy of Ophthalmology.

Holly Young, OD, received her undergraduate Bachelor of Arts degree in Biology from the University of Mississippi and her Doctorate of Optometry from the University of Alabama School of Optometry in Birmingham, Alabama. She is a member of the Beta Sigma Kappa Honor Society and the American Optometric Association. After an externship with our practice, she joined Alabama Vision Center in June 2010. Dr. Young specializes in comprehensive adult and pediatric eye examinations for the detection of medical eye diseases such as cataracts, glaucoma, macular degeneration and diabetes. She fits all types of eyeglasses and contact lens and provides preoperative and postoperative care for cataract surgery and LASIK.

Dr. Andrew Velazquez, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and advanced corneal transplantation surgery. He completed his residency at the University of Florida and a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Duke University. Dr. Velazquez has served as Assistant Professor of Ophthalmology, Director of Cornea and External Disease, and Director of Refractive Surgery at The Callahan Eye Hospital in Birmingham, Alabama. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and Clinical Assistant at the Eye Hospital.

Andrew Bartlett, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK vision correction, "no stitch" cataract surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, and corneal transplantation surgery. Born and raised in Birmingham, Dr. Bartlett attended the University of Alabama at Birmingham School of Medicine before completing his residency at Texas Tech University in Lubbock, Texas. He then continued his training with a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Eye Consultants of Atlanta.

Dr. Kelsey McCluskey, OD, graduated from Troy University with a Bachelor's of Science degree in Biomedical Science with a minor in Mathematics. She then graduated with a Doctorate of Optometry from the Kentucky College of Optometry. She is an active member of the American Optometric Association and the Alabama Optometric Association. Dr. McCluskey's clinical services include: comprehensive routine eye care, treatment and management of ocular diseases such asdiabetic retinopathy, macular degeneration, dry eyes, glaucoma, and binocular vision disorders. Dr. McCluskey also fits specialty contact lenses including scleral lenses and orthokeratology lenses for myopia control.

Dr. Jessica Duddleston, MD, is a comprehensive ophthalmologist specializing in cataract surgery, laser eye procedures, medical and surgical glaucoma, diabetic eye exams, and macular degeneration, among other things. Dr. Duddleston completed her ophthalmology residency at the distinguished University of North Carolina where she was elected chief resident during her senior year and received Resident Teacher of the year award. Her work is published in Ophthalmology Retina journal and has presented her work at Ophthalmology conferences including Women in Ophthalmology and American Academy of Ophthalmology.

Dr Goldschmidt graduated from the University of Alabama School of Optometry in 1992. She has been caring for patients in the Gardendale area for 17 years. She entered the field of Sports Vision Training by seeking out the most knowledgeable and experienced professional in this new and growing field. She chose to train with an established professional who has been working in this field for 30 years and has a track record of effectively training professional athletes and members of Police Tactical Teams and Military Special Forces. Her personal and professional goal is to help athletes and individuals perform at their peak by offering the most effective services and technology to achieve this. Her personal interests include reading anything and everything, spending time outdoors as much as possible, all kinds of arts and crafts and doing whatever is possible to help the young people in our community become educated responsible individuals. Her mission and vision for Southern Focus is to provide a professional and caring environment for our community to receive the very best in eyecare.

Dr Goldschmidt graduated from the University of Alabama School of Optometry in 1992. She has been caring for patients in the Gardendale area for 17 years. She and her husband, Lloyd, have 2 wonderful kids: Casey and Jenny. She entered the field of Sports Vision Training by seeking out the most knowledgeable and experienced professional in this new and growing field. She chose to train with an established professional who has been working in this field for 30 years and has a track record of effectively training professional athletes and members of Police Tactical Teams and Military Special Forces. Her personal and professional goal is to help athletes and individuals perform at their peak by offering the most effective services and technology to achieve this. Her personal interests include reading anything and everything, spending time outdoors as much as possible, all kinds of arts and crafts and doing whatever is possible to help the young people in our community become educated responsible individuals. Her mission and vision for Southern Focus is to provide a professional and caring environment for our community to receive the very best in eyecare.

Alabama Vision Center has established a long and true tradition of professional excellence, defined by training, experience, state-of-the-art technology and world-class care. Our goal is to enhance the quality of our patients’ lives by helping them achieve the best vision possible.

Dr. Price Kloess, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and corneal transplantation surgery. Dr. Kloess is a clinical assistant for the Eye Hospital in Birmingham. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and served as President of the Alabama Academy of Ophthalmology.

Holly Young, OD, received her undergraduate Bachelor of Arts degree in Biology from the University of Mississippi and her Doctorate of Optometry from the University of Alabama School of Optometry in Birmingham, Alabama. She is a member of the Beta Sigma Kappa Honor Society and the American Optometric Association. After an externship with our practice, she joined Alabama Vision Center in June 2010. Dr. Young specializes in comprehensive adult and pediatric eye examinations for the detection of medical eye diseases such as cataracts, glaucoma, macular degeneration and diabetes. She fits all types of eyeglasses and contact lens and provides preoperative and postoperative care for cataract surgery and LASIK.

Dr. Andrew Velazquez, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and advanced corneal transplantation surgery. He completed his residency at the University of Florida and a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Duke University. Dr. Velazquez has served as Assistant Professor of Ophthalmology, Director of Cornea and External Disease, and Director of Refractive Surgery at The Callahan Eye Hospital in Birmingham, Alabama. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and Clinical Assistant at the Eye Hospital.

Andrew Bartlett, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK vision correction, "no stitch" cataract surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, and corneal transplantation surgery. Born and raised in Birmingham, Dr. Bartlett attended the University of Alabama at Birmingham School of Medicine before completing his residency at Texas Tech University in Lubbock, Texas. He then continued his training with a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Eye Consultants of Atlanta.

Dr. Kelsey McCluskey, OD, graduated from Troy University with a Bachelor's of Science degree in Biomedical Science with a minor in Mathematics. She then graduated with a Doctorate of Optometry from the Kentucky College of Optometry. She is an active member of the American Optometric Association and the Alabama Optometric Association. Dr. McCluskey's clinical services include: comprehensive routine eye care, treatment and management of ocular diseases such asdiabetic retinopathy, macular degeneration, dry eyes, glaucoma, and binocular vision disorders. Dr. McCluskey also fits specialty contact lenses including scleral lenses and orthokeratology lenses for myopia control.

Dr. Jessica Duddleston, MD, is a comprehensive ophthalmologist specializing in cataract surgery, laser eye procedures, medical and surgical glaucoma, diabetic eye exams, and macular degeneration, among other things. Dr. Duddleston completed her ophthalmology residency at the distinguished University of North Carolina where she was elected chief resident during her senior year and received Resident Teacher of the year award. Her work is published in Ophthalmology Retina journal and has presented her work at Ophthalmology conferences including Women in Ophthalmology and American Academy of Ophthalmology.

Alabama Vision Center has established a long and true tradition of professional excellence, defined by training, experience, state-of-the-art technology and world-class care. Our goal is to enhance the quality of our patients’ lives by helping them achieve the best vision possible.

Dr. Price Kloess, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and corneal transplantation surgery. Dr. Kloess is a clinical assistant for the Eye Hospital in Birmingham. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and served as President of the Alabama Academy of Ophthalmology.

Holly Young, OD, received her undergraduate Bachelor of Arts degree in Biology from the University of Mississippi and her Doctorate of Optometry from the University of Alabama School of Optometry in Birmingham, Alabama. She is a member of the Beta Sigma Kappa Honor Society and the American Optometric Association. After an externship with our practice, she joined Alabama Vision Center in June 2010. Dr. Young specializes in comprehensive adult and pediatric eye examinations for the detection of medical eye diseases such as cataracts, glaucoma, macular degeneration and diabetes. She fits all types of eyeglasses and contact lens and provides preoperative and postoperative care for cataract surgery and LASIK.

Dr. Andrew Velazquez, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and advanced corneal transplantation surgery. He completed his residency at the University of Florida and a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Duke University. Dr. Velazquez has served as Assistant Professor of Ophthalmology, Director of Cornea and External Disease, and Director of Refractive Surgery at The Callahan Eye Hospital in Birmingham, Alabama. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and Clinical Assistant at the Eye Hospital.

Andrew Bartlett, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK vision correction, "no stitch" cataract surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, and corneal transplantation surgery. Born and raised in Birmingham, Dr. Bartlett attended the University of Alabama at Birmingham School of Medicine before completing his residency at Texas Tech University in Lubbock, Texas. He then continued his training with a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Eye Consultants of Atlanta.

Dr. Kelsey McCluskey, OD, graduated from Troy University with a Bachelor's of Science degree in Biomedical Science with a minor in Mathematics. She then graduated with a Doctorate of Optometry from the Kentucky College of Optometry. She is an active member of the American Optometric Association and the Alabama Optometric Association. Dr. McCluskey's clinical services include: comprehensive routine eye care, treatment and management of ocular diseases such asdiabetic retinopathy, macular degeneration, dry eyes, glaucoma, and binocular vision disorders. Dr. McCluskey also fits specialty contact lenses including scleral lenses and orthokeratology lenses for myopia control.

Dr. Jessica Duddleston, MD, is a comprehensive ophthalmologist specializing in cataract surgery, laser eye procedures, medical and surgical glaucoma, diabetic eye exams, and macular degeneration, among other things. Dr. Duddleston completed her ophthalmology residency at the distinguished University of North Carolina where she was elected chief resident during her senior year and received Resident Teacher of the year award. Her work is published in Ophthalmology Retina journal and has presented her work at Ophthalmology conferences including Women in Ophthalmology and American Academy of Ophthalmology.

Dr Goldschmidt graduated from the University of Alabama School of Optometry in 1992. She has been caring for patients in the Gardendale area for 17 years. Her personal interests include reading anything and everything, spending time outdoors as much as possible, all kinds of arts and crafts and doing whatever is possible to help the young people in our community become educated responsible individuals. Her mission and vision for Southern Focus is to provide a professional and caring environment for our community to receive the very best in eyecare.

Do you feel like your eye doctor never really dives in to help you figure out the best options for your vision? Dr Goldschmidt graduated from the University of Alabama School of Optometry in 1992. She has been caring for patients in the Gardendale area for 17 years. She is a member of the Alabama Optometric Association, American Optometric Society, American Optometric Society Sports Vision and NATA National Association of Athletic Trainers She was raised in Pelham Alabama and earned a Bachelors of Science degree at Auburn University. She and her husband, Lloyd, have 2 wonderful kids: Casey and Jenny. She entered the field of Sports Vision Training by seeking out the most knowledgeable and experienced professional in this new and growing field. She chose to train with an established professional who has been working in this field for 30 years and has a track record of effectively training professional athletes and members of Police Tactical Teams and Military Special Forces. Her personal and professional goal is to help athletes and individuals perform at their peak by offering the most effective services and technology to achieve this. Her personal interests include reading anything and everything, spending time outdoors as much as possible, all kinds of arts and crafts and doing whatever is possible to help the young people in our community become educated responsible individuals. Her mission and vision for Southern Focus is to provide a professional and caring environment for our community to receive the very best in eyecare.

Annual eye exams are a recommended cornerstone for ensuring the health of your eyes. In addition to checking for changes in your vision and updating your prescription, we will also look at your overall eye health, internally and externally. Prevention and early detection are keys to maintaining healthy eyes, as some eye health issues have no immediate symptoms but can still cause damage if left untreated. That’s why regular check-ups are critical.

Alabama Vision Center has established a long and true tradition of professional excellence, defined by training, experience, state-of-the-art technology and world-class care. Our goal is to enhance the quality of our patients’ lives by helping them achieve the best vision possible.

Dr. Price Kloess, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and corneal transplantation surgery. Dr. Kloess is a clinical assistant for the Eye Hospital in Birmingham. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and served as President of the Alabama Academy of Ophthalmology.

Holly Young, OD, received her undergraduate Bachelor of Arts degree in Biology from the University of Mississippi and her Doctorate of Optometry from the University of Alabama School of Optometry in Birmingham, Alabama. She is a member of the Beta Sigma Kappa Honor Society and the American Optometric Association. After an externship with our practice, she joined Alabama Vision Center in June 2010. Dr. Young specializes in comprehensive adult and pediatric eye examinations for the detection of medical eye diseases such as cataracts, glaucoma, macular degeneration and diabetes. She fits all types of eyeglasses and contact lens and provides preoperative and postoperative care for cataract surgery and LASIK.

Dr. Andrew Velazquez, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and advanced corneal transplantation surgery. He completed his residency at the University of Florida and a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Duke University. Dr. Velazquez has served as Assistant Professor of Ophthalmology, Director of Cornea and External Disease, and Director of Refractive Surgery at The Callahan Eye Hospital in Birmingham, Alabama. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and Clinical Assistant at the Eye Hospital.

Andrew Bartlett, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK vision correction, "no stitch" cataract surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, and corneal transplantation surgery. Born and raised in Birmingham, Dr. Bartlett attended the University of Alabama at Birmingham School of Medicine before completing his residency at Texas Tech University in Lubbock, Texas. He then continued his training with a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Eye Consultants of Atlanta.

Dr. Kelsey McCluskey, OD, graduated from Troy University with a Bachelor's of Science degree in Biomedical Science with a minor in Mathematics. She then graduated with a Doctorate of Optometry from the Kentucky College of Optometry. She is an active member of the American Optometric Association and the Alabama Optometric Association. Dr. McCluskey's clinical services include: comprehensive routine eye care, treatment and management of ocular diseases such asdiabetic retinopathy, macular degeneration, dry eyes, glaucoma, and binocular vision disorders. Dr. McCluskey also fits specialty contact lenses including scleral lenses and orthokeratology lenses for myopia control.

Dr. Jessica Duddleston, MD, is a comprehensive ophthalmologist specializing in cataract surgery, laser eye procedures, medical and surgical glaucoma, diabetic eye exams, and macular degeneration, among other things. Dr. Duddleston completed her ophthalmology residency at the distinguished University of North Carolina where she was elected chief resident during her senior year and received Resident Teacher of the year award. Her work is published in Ophthalmology Retina journal and has presented her work at Ophthalmology conferences including Women in Ophthalmology and American Academy of Ophthalmology.

He received his undergraduate degree with honors from Harvard University and his medical degree with honors from the Syracuse College of Medicine at the State University of New York. His specialty training in ophthalmology was done at Vanderbilt University, followed by a 2 year ASOPRS fellowship in oculoplastic, orbital, and reconstructive surgery at UAB Medical Center and The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital. He is a member and he serves as an associate preceptor for The American Society of Oculoplastics and Reconstructive Surgery (ASOPRS) in the training of certified fellows. Dr. Vicinanzo is certified by the American Board of Ophthalmology and is a diplomat of the American Academy of Ophthalmology. Alabama Vision Center has established a long and true tradition of professional excellence, defined by training, experience, state-of-the-art technology and world-class care. Our goal is to enhance the quality of our patients’ lives by helping them achieve the best vision possible.

Dr. Price Kloess, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and corneal transplantation surgery. Dr. Kloess is a clinical assistant for the Eye Hospital in Birmingham. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and served as President of the Alabama Academy of Ophthalmology.

Holly Young, OD, received her undergraduate Bachelor of Arts degree in Biology from the University of Mississippi and her Doctorate of Optometry from the University of Alabama School of Optometry in Birmingham, Alabama. She is a member of the Beta Sigma Kappa Honor Society and the American Optometric Association. After an externship with our practice, she joined Alabama Vision Center in June 2010. Dr. Young specializes in comprehensive adult and pediatric eye examinations for the detection of medical eye diseases such as cataracts, glaucoma, macular degeneration and diabetes. She fits all types of eyeglasses and contact lens and provides preoperative and postoperative care for cataract surgery and LASIK.

Dr. Andrew Velazquez, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and advanced corneal transplantation surgery. He completed his residency at the University of Florida and a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Duke University. Dr. Velazquez has served as Assistant Professor of Ophthalmology, Director of Cornea and External Disease, and Director of Refractive Surgery at The Callahan Eye Hospital in Birmingham, Alabama. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and Clinical Assistant at the Eye Hospital.

Andrew Bartlett, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK vision correction, "no stitch" cataract surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, and corneal transplantation surgery. Born and raised in Birmingham, Dr. Bartlett attended the University of Alabama at Birmingham School of Medicine before completing his residency at Texas Tech University in Lubbock, Texas. He then continued his training with a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Eye Consultants of Atlanta.

Dr. Kelsey McCluskey, OD, graduated from Troy University with a Bachelor's of Science degree in Biomedical Science with a minor in Mathematics. She then graduated with a Doctorate of Optometry from the Kentucky College of Optometry. She is an active member of the American Optometric Association and the Alabama Optometric Association. Dr. McCluskey's clinical services include: comprehensive routine eye care, treatment and management of ocular diseases such asdiabetic retinopathy, macular degeneration, dry eyes, glaucoma, and binocular vision disorders. Dr. McCluskey also fits specialty contact lenses including scleral lenses and orthokeratology lenses for myopia control.

Dr. Jessica Duddleston, MD, is a comprehensive ophthalmologist specializing in cataract surgery, laser eye procedures, medical and surgical glaucoma, diabetic eye exams, and macular degeneration, among other things. Dr. Duddleston completed her ophthalmology residency at the distinguished University of North Carolina where she was elected chief resident during her senior year and received Resident Teacher of the year award. Her work is published in Ophthalmology Retina journal and has presented her work at Ophthalmology conferences including Women in Ophthalmology and American Academy of Ophthalmology.

Dr Goldschmidt graduated from the University of Alabama School of Optometry in 1992. She has been caring for patients in the Gardendale area for 17 years. She is a member of the Alabama Optometric Association, American Optometric Society, American Optometric Society Sports Vision and NATA National Association of Athletic Trainers She was raised in Pelham Alabama and earned a Bachelors of Science degree at Auburn University. She and her husband, Lloyd, have 2 wonderful kids: Casey and Jenny. She entered the field of Sports Vision Training by seeking out the most knowledgeable and experienced professional in this new and growing field. She chose to train with an established professional who has been working in this field for 30 years and has a track record of effectively training professional athletes and members of Police Tactical Teams and Military Special Forces. Her personal and professional goal is to help athletes and individuals perform at their peak by offering the most effective services and technology to achieve this. Her personal interests include reading anything and everything, spending time outdoors as much as possible, all kinds of arts and crafts and doing whatever is possible to help the young people in our community become educated responsible individuals. Her mission and vision for Southern Focus is to provide a professional and caring environment for our community to receive the very best in eyecare.

Dr. Young specializes in comprehensive adult and pediatric eye examinations for the detection of medical eye diseases such as cataracts, glaucoma, macular degeneration and diabetes. She fits all types of eyeglasses and contact lens and provides preoperative and postoperative care for cataract surgery and LASIK.

Dr. Andrew Velazquez, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and advanced corneal transplantation surgery. He completed his residency at the University of Florida and a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Duke University. Dr. Velazquez has served as Assistant Professor of Ophthalmology, Director of Cornea and External Disease, and Director of Refractive Surgery at The Callahan Eye Hospital in Birmingham, Alabama. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and Clinical Assistant at the Eye Hospital.

Andrew Bartlett, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK vision correction, "no stitch" cataract surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, and corneal transplantation surgery. Born and raised in Birmingham, Dr. Bartlett attended the University of Alabama at Birmingham School of Medicine before completing his residency at Texas Tech University in Lubbock, Texas. He then continued his training with a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Eye Consultants of Atlanta.

Dr. Kelsey McCluskey, OD, graduated from Troy University with a Bachelor's of Science degree in Biomedical Science with a minor in Mathematics. She then graduated with a Doctorate of Optometry from the Kentucky College of Optometry. She is an active member of the American Optometric Association and the Alabama Optometric Association. Dr. McCluskey's clinical services include: comprehensive routine eye care, treatment and management of ocular diseases such asdiabetic retinopathy, macular degeneration, dry eyes, glaucoma, and binocular vision disorders. Dr. McCluskey also fits specialty contact lenses including scleral lenses and orthokeratology lenses for myopia control.

Dr. Jessica Duddleston, MD, is a comprehensive ophthalmologist specializing in cataract surgery, laser eye procedures, medical and surgical glaucoma, diabetic eye exams, and macular degeneration, among other things. Dr. Duddleston completed her ophthalmology residency at the distinguished University of North Carolina where she was elected chief resident during her senior year and received Resident Teacher of the year award. Her work is published in Ophthalmology Retina journal and has presented her work at Ophthalmology conferences including Women in Ophthalmology and American Academy of Ophthalmology.

Dr Goldschmidt graduated from the University of Alabama School of Optometry in 1992. She has been caring for patients in the Gardendale area for 17 years. She is a member of the Alabama Optometric Association, American Optometric Society, American Optometric Society Sports Vision and NATA National Association of Athletic Trainers She was raised in Pelham Alabama and earned a Bachelors of Science degree at Auburn University. She and her husband, Lloyd, have 2 wonderful kids: Casey and Jenny. She entered the field of Sports Vision Training by seeking out the most knowledgeable and experienced professional in this new and growing field. She chose to train with an established professional who has been working in this field for 30 years and has a track record of effectively training professional athletes and members of Police Tactical Teams and Military Special Forces. Her personal and professional goal is to help athletes and individuals perform at their peak by offering the most effective services and technology to achieve this. Her personal interests include reading anything and everything, spending time outdoors as much as possible, all kinds of arts and crafts and doing whatever is possible to help the young people in our community become educated responsible individuals. Her mission and vision for Southern Focus is to provide a professional and caring environment for our community to receive the very best in eyecare.

Dr. VicinanzoÃƒÂ¢Ã¢"šÂ¬Ã¢"žÂ¢s practice encompasses reconstructive and cosmetic surgery of the orbits, eyelids, brows, and lacrimal system due to trauma, cancer, congenital defects, systemic diseases, and aging. He received his undergraduate degree with honors from Harvard University and his medical degree with honors from the Syracuse College of Medicine at the State University of New York. His specialty training in ophthalmology was done at Vanderbilt University, followed by a 2 year ASOPRS fellowship in oculoplastic, orbital, and reconstructive surgery at UAB Medical Center and The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital. Dr. Vicinanzo serves as an Assistant Clinical Professor for the Department of Ophthalmology at UAB, where he actively teaches oculoplastic surgery to the resident doctors at The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital, the Birmingham VA Hospital, and UAB Medial Center. He is a member and he serves as an associate preceptor for The American Society of Oculoplastics and Reconstructive Surgery (ASOPRS) in the training of certified fellows. Dr. Vicinanzo is certified by the American Board of Ophthalmology and is a diplomat of the American Academy of Ophthalmology. He is currently involved in multiple eye and oculplastic research studies. Dr. Vicinanzo was elected to Best Doctors in America in 2009. Dr. Price Kloess, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and corneal transplantation surgery. Dr. Kloess is a clinical assistant for the Eye Hospital in Birmingham. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and served as President of the Alabama Academy of Ophthalmology.

Holly Young, OD, received her undergraduate Bachelor of Arts degree in Biology from the University of Mississippi and her Doctorate of Optometry from the University of Alabama School of Optometry in Birmingham, Alabama. She is a member of the Beta Sigma Kappa Honor Society and the American Optometric Association. After an externship with our practice, she joined Alabama Vision Center in June 2010. Dr. Young specializes in comprehensive adult and pediatric eye examinations for the detection of medical eye diseases such as cataracts, glaucoma, macular degeneration and diabetes. She fits all types of eyeglasses and contact lens and provides preoperative and postoperative care for cataract surgery and LASIK.

Dr. Andrew Velazquez, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and advanced corneal transplantation surgery. He completed his residency at the University of Florida and a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Duke University. Dr. Velazquez has served as Assistant Professor of Ophthalmology, Director of Cornea and External Disease, and Director of Refractive Surgery at The Callahan Eye Hospital in Birmingham, Alabama. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and Clinical Assistant at the Eye Hospital.

Andrew Bartlett, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK vision correction, "no stitch" cataract surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, and corneal transplantation surgery. Born and raised in Birmingham, Dr. Bartlett attended the University of Alabama at Birmingham School of Medicine before completing his residency at Texas Tech University in Lubbock, Texas. He then continued his training with a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Eye Consultants of Atlanta.

Dr. Kelsey McCluskey, OD, graduated from Troy University with a Bachelor's of Science degree in Biomedical Science with a minor in Mathematics. She then graduated with a Doctorate of Optometry from the Kentucky College of Optometry. She is an active member of the American Optometric Association and the Alabama Optometric Association. Dr. McCluskey's clinical services include: comprehensive routine eye care, treatment and management of ocular diseases such asdiabetic retinopathy, macular degeneration, dry eyes, glaucoma, and binocular vision disorders. Dr. McCluskey also fits specialty contact lenses including scleral lenses and orthokeratology lenses for myopia control.

Dr. Jessica Duddleston, MD, is a comprehensive ophthalmologist specializing in cataract surgery, laser eye procedures, medical and surgical glaucoma, diabetic eye exams, and macular degeneration, among other things. Dr. Duddleston completed her ophthalmology residency at the distinguished University of North Carolina where she was elected chief resident during her senior year and received Resident Teacher of the year award. Her work is published in Ophthalmology Retina journal and has presented her work at Ophthalmology conferences including Women in Ophthalmology and American Academy of Ophthalmology.

Alabama Vision Center has established a long and true tradition of professional excellence, defined by training, experience, state-of-the-art technology and world-class care. Our goal is to enhance the quality of our patients’ lives by helping them achieve the best vision possible.

Dr. Price Kloess, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and corneal transplantation surgery. Dr. Kloess is a clinical assistant for the Eye Hospital in Birmingham. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and served as President of the Alabama Academy of Ophthalmology.

Holly Young, OD, received her undergraduate Bachelor of Arts degree in Biology from the University of Mississippi and her Doctorate of Optometry from the University of Alabama School of Optometry in Birmingham, Alabama. She is a member of the Beta Sigma Kappa Honor Society and the American Optometric Association. After an externship with our practice, she joined Alabama Vision Center in June 2010. Dr. Young specializes in comprehensive adult and pediatric eye examinations for the detection of medical eye diseases such as cataracts, glaucoma, macular degeneration and diabetes. She fits all types of eyeglasses and contact lens and provides preoperative and postoperative care for cataract surgery and LASIK.

Dr. Andrew Velazquez, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK laser vision correction, "no stitch" cataract laser and surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, phakic IOL surgery, and advanced corneal transplantation surgery. He completed his residency at the University of Florida and a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Duke University. Dr. Velazquez has served as Assistant Professor of Ophthalmology, Director of Cornea and External Disease, and Director of Refractive Surgery at The Callahan Eye Hospital in Birmingham, Alabama. He is a fellow of the American Academy of Ophthalmology and Clinical Assistant at the Eye Hospital.

Andrew Bartlett, MD, FAAO, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained ophthalmologist specializing in blade-free all laser custom LASIK vision correction, "no stitch" cataract surgery, refractive lens exchange with bifocal implants, and corneal transplantation surgery. Born and raised in Birmingham, Dr. Bartlett attended the University of Alabama at Birmingham School of Medicine before completing his residency at Texas Tech University in Lubbock, Texas. He then continued his training with a Cornea and Refractive Surgery Fellowship at Eye Consultants of Atlanta.

Dr. Kelsey McCluskey, OD, graduated from Troy University with a Bachelor's of Science degree in Biomedical Science with a minor in Mathematics. She then graduated with a Doctorate of Optometry from the Kentucky College of Optometry. She is an active member of the American Optometric Association and the Alabama Optometric Association. Dr. McCluskey's clinical services include: comprehensive routine eye care, treatment and management of ocular diseases such asdiabetic retinopathy, macular degeneration, dry eyes, glaucoma, and binocular vision disorders. Dr. McCluskey also fits specialty contact lenses including scleral lenses and orthokeratology lenses for myopia control.

Dr. Jessica Duddleston, MD, is a comprehensive ophthalmologist specializing in cataract surgery, laser eye procedures, medical and surgical glaucoma, diabetic eye exams, and macular degeneration, among other things. Dr. Duddleston completed her ophthalmology residency at the distinguished University of North Carolina where she was elected chief resident during her senior year and received Resident Teacher of the year award. Her work is published in Ophthalmology Retina journal and has presented her work at Ophthalmology conferences including Women in Ophthalmology and American Academy of Ophthalmology.

Dr Goldschmidt graduated from the University of Alabama School of Optometry in 1992. She has been caring for patients in the Gardendale area for 17 years. She is a member of the Alabama Optometric Association, American Optometric Society, American Optometric Society Sports Vision and NATA National Association of Athletic Trainers She was raised in Pelham Alabama and earned a Bachelors of Science degree at Auburn University. She and her husband, Lloyd, have 2 wonderful kids: Casey and Jenny. She entered the field of Sports Vision Training by seeking out the most knowledgeable and experienced professional in this new and growing field. She chose to train with an established professional who has been working in this field for 30 years and has a track record of effectively training professional athletes and members of Police Tactical Teams and Military Special Forces. Her personal and professional goal is to help athletes and individuals perform at their peak by offering the most effective services and technology to achieve this. Her personal interests include reading anything and everything, spending time outdoors as much as possible, all kinds of arts and crafts and doing whatever is possible to help the young people in our community become educated responsible individuals. Her mission and vision for Southern Focus is to provide a professional and caring environment for our community to receive the very best in eyecare.

Family First Vision Care - Riverchase is your neighborhood eye doctor located at 1717-117 Montgomery Hwy. Your Hoover eyecare center offers genuine eye care where your eye health and wellness is our primary focus. 
Annual eye exams are a recommended cornerstone for ensuring the health of your eyes. In addition to checking for changes in your vision and updating your prescription, we will also look at your overall eye health, internally and externally. Prevention and early detection are keys to maintaining healthy eyes, as some eye health issues have no immediate symptoms but can still cause damage if left untreated. That’s why regular check-ups are critical.
